data.enText: to take sb away illegally and keep them as a prisoner, especially in order to get money or sth else for returning them

data.chText: 两名商人遭恐怖分子绑架。
data.enText: Two businessmen have been kidnapped by terrorists.
The kidnappers are demanding a ransom of $1 million.

data.chText: 他对绑架的指控供认不讳。
data.enText: He admitted the charge of kidnap.

tr: take away to an undisclosed location against their will and usually in order to extract a ransom

value.boxr_value: in AM, also use 美国英语亦用 kidnaped

value.def: To kidnap someone is to take them away illegally and by force, and usually to hold them prisoner in order to demand something from their family, employer, or government.

example.ex: Police in Brazil uncovered a plot to kidnap him...
example.tran: 巴西警方发现了有人要绑架他的阴谋。

example.ex: They were intelligent and educated, yet they chose to kidnap and kill...
example.tran: 他们聪明且有教养，却选择去绑架和杀人。

example.ex: The kidnapped man was said to have been seized by five people.
example.tran: 据说那名男子是被5个人绑架的。

example.ex: His kidnappers have threatened that they will kill him unless three militants are released from prison.
example.tran: 绑架他的绑匪威胁说，如果不释放3名激进分子他们就杀了他。

example.ex: Two youngsters have been arrested and charged with kidnapping.
example.tran: 已有两名年轻人被逮捕并被控绑架。

value.def: Kidnap or a kidnap is the crime of taking someone away by force.

example.ex: Stewart denies attempted murder and kidnap...
example.tran: 斯图尔特否认对其谋杀未遂和绑架的指控。

example.ex: He was charged with the kidnap of a 25 year-old woman.
example.tran: 他被指控绑架一名25岁的女子。
